name: review
instruction:
The user wants a code review of their uncommitted changes.
You MUST invoke the kw-plugin:review-code skill using the Skill tool.
Pass argument "1" for uncommitted changes unless the user specifies otherwise.

name: use-opus
instruction:
MODEL PREFERENCE: Use claude-opus-4-5-20251101 for all Task tool subagent calls.
When spawning agents via the Task tool, always set model: "opus".
This is the most capable and expensive model — use it for complex reasoning, architecture decisions, and thorough analysis.

name: use-sonnet
instruction:
MODEL PREFERENCE: Use claude-sonnet-4-20250514 for all Task tool subagent calls.
When spawning agents via the Task tool, always set model: "sonnet".
This is the balanced model — good reasoning at moderate cost.

name: use-haiku
instruction:
MODEL PREFERENCE: Use claude-haiku-4-5-20251001 for all Task tool subagent calls.
When spawning agents via the Task tool, always set model: "haiku".
This is the fastest and cheapest model — use it to minimize cost. Accept reduced reasoning quality.

name: thorough
instruction:
The user wants an exceptionally thorough analysis.
Take extra time. Check every edge case. Consider security implications.
Do NOT rush. Quality over speed. If reviewing code, check:
- Every error path and edge case
- Security: injection, auth, data exposure
- Performance: N+1 queries, unnecessary allocations
- Missing tests for new/changed behavior

name: ship
instruction:
The user wants to move fast and get this done.
Be concise. Skip lengthy explanations. Focus on action.
Make decisions instead of asking questions when the answer is obvious.
If something needs to be done, just do it.
